item.title: Cabin COMPT TEMP Control Systems – (FWD/AFT Cabin)

remarks.para: May be inoperative provided associated zone trim air modulating valve remains closed.

note.para: Consideration must be given to perishable cargo in affected zone (FWD/AFT Cabin).

placard.para: Placard respective Cabin Temp Selector "DO-NOT-OPERATE" and enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

numlitem.para: Affected Zone Trim Air Modulating Valve Closed:
Position affected Compartment Temperature Control as follows: FWD CAB or AFT CAB cabin, rotate temperature control to OFF.
Check on EICAS ECS/MSG page that the affected TRIM VALVE is in the full closed (between 0.00 and 0.05) position.
If the valve fails to close using the above procedure, a Block-Turn-Back is required to accomplish the following procedure.
Trim air modulating valves are located in the mix bay at the aft end of the forward cargo compartment.
Place affected Compartment Temperature Control to OFF.
Gain access to the forward cargo compartment.
Remove aft center bulkhead lining of the forward cargo compartment (Ref. MM 25-50-03).
Locate affected trim air modulating valve.
Disconnect, cap and stow electrical connector from affected valve.
Check valve position, if not closed rotate the manual override knob counterclockwise until the position indicator on the valve shows valve closed.
Reinstall aft center bulkhead lining in cargo compartment.
